document_name: Lakes State Stabilization Programme 2013 Annual Work Plan

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
The Jonglei Stabilization Programme (JSP) is a UN Joint Programme that aims to increase security and reduce level of ethnic conflict in Jonglei State by:
1. Establishing a state-managed radio station in Bor, Jonglei (implemented by UNDP);  
2. Constructing 170km Akobo-Pochalla road without surfacing (implemented by UNOPS); and
3. Constructing, equipping and staffing three ranger posts with ablution blocks and boreholes for ensuring effective monitoring, conservation awareness and compliance with wildlife laws and regulations, along the Akobo-Pochalla road (implemented by WCS through UNDP).  
As the Coordinating Agency of the JSP, UNDP oversees, coordinates, monitors and provides technical support to the implementation of JSP Outputs, through close collaboration with the Jonglei State Government, UNOPS and Wildlife Conservation Society.

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
The Eastern Equatoria Stabilization Programme (EESP) is a UN Joint Programme that aims to increase security and reduce level of ethnic conflict in Eastern Equatoria State by:
1. Rehabilitating and surfacing Lobira-Romula-Lotome-Kikalay Kanangorok Road (implemented by UNOPS); 
2. Constructing and equipping four county headquarters in Kapoeta North, Kapoeta South, Magwi and Imehejek and constructing one prison (200 detainee capacity) with administration block and holding cell in Kapoeta North County (implemented by UNOPS); and  
3. Constructing four haffirs (30,000m³ each), six human consumption water access points and one water filtration unit (implemented by PACT Sudan through UNDP). 
As the Coordinating Agency of the EESP, UNDP oversees, coordinates, monitors and provides technical support to the implementation of EESP Outputs, through close collaboration with the Eastern Equatoria State Government, UNOPS and PACT.

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr:
The Lakes State Stabilization Programme (LSSP) is a UN Joint Programme that aims to increase security and reduce level of ethnic conflict in Lakes State by:
1. Constructing Karich-Poloich-Amok Piny- Panyijar and Aluakluak-Akuoc Cok roads through a labour based and mechanized approach (implemented by WFP);
2. Constructing four haffirs (30,000m³ each) and 16 boreholes in Ngok-Jak, Agar, Nyankot and Abririu (implemented by UNOPS); and
3. Constructing two county police stations in Awerial and Mapear and five payam police stations in Adior, Amongping, Malek, Billing and Yiar-dong, as well as seven courts in Mapear, Wulu, Nyang, Awerial, Rumbek Center, Cueibet, and Rumbek East (implemented by UNOPS). 
As the Coordinating Agency of the LSSP, UNDP oversees, coordinates, monitors and provides technical support to the implementation of LSSP Outputs, through close collaboration with the Lakes State Government, WFP and UNOPS.

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr: A Rapid Stabilization Facility (RSF) is required to address emerging stabilization needs through smaller scale, quick impact interventions or responses, as well as to complement current stabilization programmes and projects in South Sudan.

project_descr: SSRF-UN Joint Stabilization Programmes (Eastern Equatoria, Jonglei, Lakes & Warrap) and Rapid Stabilization Facility (RSF)
